page.title: 20PITMIDDLE NEAR ABERNYTE
page.content: Pitmiddle was once a village in the S.W.of the area on the southern slope of Pitmiddle Hill.In 1985 all that is left are the remains of 8 houses and some old furniture.The paths are and gardens are overgrown and the cattle wander on the hillside The main jobs were at one time farming on small crofts,looking after cattle and weaving (before Dundees mill was built).One Custom was when cows were taken to graze on the hill a boy blew a horn and 20-30 cows were unchained and herded onto the hill. Once the motor car was invented roads gradually became better but the road to Pitmiddle was never made up and by 1945 the last people began to move away.Today Pitmiddle attracts many tourists looking for the ruined village going there for walks and picnics on the hill.
